</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Event Handlers

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Defines an action performed after the preload screen finished. Preload event occurs after briefing screen on mission start.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This event handler also fires on client after user closes the main map. </value></part></template><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Since '''Arma 3''' ''v1.57'' a stackable version of this EH is available: [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PreloadFinished|PreloadFinished]]</value></part></template><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In order to keep compatibility between official and community content the functions [[BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler]] and [[BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler]] should be used instead.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''onPreloadFinished''' command

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> command: [[String]] or [[Code]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[onPreloadFinished]] {TAG_ReceivingScreenDone = [[true]]};</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>//removes the event immediately after the first run again
[[onPreloadFinished]] {TAG_ReceivingScreenDone = [[true]]; [[onPreloadFinished]] ""};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[onPreloadStarted]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 24, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tophe|Tophe]]</dt>
<dd class="note">There is a bug in Arma2 that will make this command execute every time the screen with "Receiving..." has been displayed. <br>
If this code is put in the Init.sqf it will run the startcam.sqf script when the loading screen has disappeared <br>
 <ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>onPreloadFinished '[fire1] execVM "scripts\startcam.sqf"';</inner><close></pre></close></ext>
It will however also run every time a player change graphics settings, alt-tab or do anything else that will trigger the loading screen.<br>
You will have to script around it with if statements to get it to run only in the beginning of the mission.<br>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
